meanings.def: used to say that something cannot be avoided
examples: The number of places available is necessarily limited.
Servants necessarily had close contact with their employers.

meanings.def: used to say that something is possibly true but not definitely or always true
examples: It isn't necessarily true that sugar is bad for you.
The more expensive articles are not necessarily better.
The views in this article do not necessarily reflect those of the college.

idioms.def: used to say that something is possibly true but not definitely or always true
examples: It isn't necessarily true that sugar is bad for you.
The more expensive articles are not necessarily better.
The views in this article do not necessarily reflect those of the college.
